result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:12 AM Defendant Amanda M Galkowski in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg appeared by phone for Amanda M Galkowski.  Prosecuting attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense indicates he was recently appointed. Defendant is seeking to modify her bond. Still needs time to obtain discovery. 
State objects to a bond modification in both of cases and provides arguments as to why. Provides email to Defense to request discovery. Puts offer on the record. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Confidential Crime Victim Information
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE
TO TRACK IN SAME BRANCH AS OPEN MISDEMEANOR CASE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. No contact with the victim L.J (person, property, residence or family).

1:45 PM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Amanda M Galkowski appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Natalie Probst appeared by video for Amanda M Galkowski. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
